item.title: Getting PyCharm to work with pyenv local
item.description: I write the majority of my code in Sublime Text, favouring it over a full blown IDE like PyCharm or Eclipse. However, I cannot argue with the debugging abilities that an IDE provides. Recently I tried to use PyCharm’s debugging functionality, and although when adding the folder as a PyCharm project and specifying the relevant pyenv virtualenv1 Python path (see image below), PyCharm just could not seem to find it.
